meta.title: Bug Loop | Blog of a Digital Book Writer
meta.description: A blog that captures the intimate reflections of a writer who truly loves the medium of writing.

header.futureService: Developing an unprecedented service, launching in 2027. Stay tuned!

profile.profile-bio1: A lifelong learner majoring in Computer Science and Hacking & Information Security at Hanyang Cyber University. He finds joy in honest, reflective communication through writing.
profile.profile-bio2: After earning a B.A. in Composition from Hanyang University, he studied Acoustics for two years at Le Mans University in France. Passionate about creating music that isnâ€™t bound by purpose, and the toolsâ€”virtual instrumentsâ€”that make such freedom possible.
profile.profile-bio3: A visually impaired developer who once studied Physics at Le Mans University and Sound Design at Le Mans Beaux-Arts before leaving due to misalignment with the academic atmosphere. Now he dedicates himself to exploring digital wellness, inner stability, and sustainable happiness through technology.

panel.title: Bug Loop â€” The Digital Book Writer
panel.body:
A book is like subtitles to a movie.

To truly read a book, one must hold either experience (memory) or the desire for it (imagination). Letters, when glanced at without intent, are merely lines drawn here and there. But for the meaning woven between those lines to come alive, a connection must first form between the text and the reader. That bridge is the inner screen of oneâ€™s mind â€” where scenes are projected that only the self can fully perceive: memory and imagination.

In its traditional form, a book exists as text flowing in one direction. But an e-book is different. The word 'electron' refers to a tiny entity that emits an electric force â€” even a subtle fluctuation in it spreads at the speed of light. Through this nature, a reader can leap from the first page to the last in an instant, and weave in media from other dimensions such as sound and motion. These layers deepen and enrich the act of reading.

An e-book is not merely a book made easy to copy or distribute. It is something far greater â€” a living medium of light and language. This blog is a record of my journey to explore what that means.

Mais pour que le sens nÃ© de leur enchevÃªtrement prenne vie, un lien doit dâ€™abord se former entre le texte et le lecteur. Ce lien, câ€™est lâ€™Ã©cran intÃ©rieur oÃ¹ se projettent des scÃ¨nes que seul soi-mÃªme peut percevoir dans leur forme complÃ¨te : la mÃ©moire et lâ€™imagination.

panel.title: Bug Loop â€” El escritor de libros digitales
panel.body:
Un libro es como los subtÃ­tulos de una pelÃ­cula.

Para leer un libro de verdad, se necesita una de estas dos cosas: experiencia (memoria) o el deseo de tenerla (imaginaciÃ³n). Las letras, vistas con indiferencia, no son mÃ¡s que lÃ­neas garabateadas. Sin embargo, para que el significado que se teje entre esas lÃ­neas se sienta realmente, primero debe formarse una relaciÃ³n entre el texto y el lector. El papel de este intermediario lo juega la pantalla interior del individuo, donde se proyectan escenas que solo uno mismo puede ver en su forma completa: la memoria y la imaginaciÃ³n.

El libro en su sentido tradicional existe como caracteres dispuestos en una sola direcciÃ³n. Pero el libro digital es diferente. El electrÃ³n es una partÃ­cula que emite energÃ­a elÃ©ctrica, y hasta el cambio mÃ¡s mÃ­nimo en esa energÃ­a se propaga a la velocidad de la luz. Esta propiedad permite saltar de la primera a la Ãºltima pÃ¡gina al instante, e incluir medios de otra dimensiÃ³n, como audio o vÃ­deo, entre los caracteres. Todo esto contribuye positivamente a enriquecer la experiencia de la escritura.

Un libro digital no es simplemente un libro fÃ¡cil de copiar y publicar. Â¡Es mucho mÃ¡s que eso! Este blog es un registro del viaje de exploraciÃ³n de su valor.
